f0.description:
This base font-size is expressed in pixels (px) for min. viewport.


A base font-size is the starting point for the text content on a web page. It acts as a reference for determining the sizes of all other fonts. It is commonly expressed in pixels (px) or relative units such as percentages (%).

This base font-size is expressed in pixels (px) for max. viewport.


A base font-size is the starting point for the text content on a web page. It acts as a reference for determining the sizes of all other fonts. It is commonly expressed in pixels (px) or relative units such as percentages (%).

min.description: The minimum value the property can take.

max.description: The maximum value the property can take.

fluid.description: The preferred value or ideal size for the property.

container.description: Horisontal & vertical menu, cards (Product),  Navigation bar, Tab bar, Bottom sheet (Native)

default.description: Default text colour on body, header

primary.description: Primary text colour on ui controls

emphasised.description: Emphasised text colour on important text and links, titles, headers

warning.description: Warning text colour on body, headers

normal.description: Input field, default button, search bar on normal & disabled state

medium.description: Input field, default button, search bar on hover state

high.description: Input field, default button, search bar on pressed state

max1.description: Input field, default button, search bar on selected state 1

max2.description: Input field, default button, search bar on selected state 2

normal.description: Input field, default button, search bar on normal, pressed & selected state

medium.description: Input field, default button, search bar on hover state

max2.description: Input field, default button, search bar on selected state 2

low.description: Input field, default button, search bar on disabled state

default.description: Default alerts. Lower prio statuses such as pairing

blue.description: Normal alerts. Common statuses such as created, sent, printed, processing

purple.description: Alerts. Temporary statuses such as drafts

orange.description: Alerts, toasts, tooltips. Warnings and potential problem statuses such as partially paid, losses

red.description: Alerts, toasts, tooltips. Errors and failure statuses such as rejected, not sent, overdue, not delivered

green.description: Alerts, toasts. Success and positive statuses such as accepted, paid, delivered

red.description: Alerts, toasts, tooltips. Errors and failure statuses such as rejected, not sent, overdue, not delivered

green.description: Alerts, toasts. Success and positive statuses such as accepted, paid, delivered

h4.description: The <h4> tag is an HTML element used to define a fourth-level heading on a webpage or within a section of content.

h3.description: The <h3> tag is an HTML element used to define a third-level heading on a webpage or within a section of content.

h2.description: The <h2> tag is commonly used as subheadings to organize and structure the content within a webpage or section.

h1.description: The <h1> tag is commonly used to display the main title of a webpage.
